title: Demi Lovato shares bikini snap after recent unfiltered Instagram photo
text:
Demi loves a mirror selfie as much as the rest of us (Picture: Demi Lovato/Instagram)

Demi Lovato is continuing her public journey to loving her body as she posted another unfiltered bikini snap to Instagram, just weeks after admitting that she used to doctor her own photos for social media.

Wearing an incredible leopard print two-piece (we’re not jealous at all!), the star was clearly feeling herself as she posed and pouted in the mirror.

We’re particularly loving the colour coordination between the lime green strings bikini, Demi’s nails and the green in her hair – now that’s commitment to a look.

Captioning the post as sassily as ever, the Cool For The Summer singer wrote: ‘No photoshop pls & thank u.’

You tell ‘em girl.

Thanking Brazilian swimwear brand Maré-Maré for her ‘new fav [sic] bikini’, the 27-year-old wrote: ‘y’all know my thing for leopard print bikinis and now of course lime green.’

Girl knows her angles (Picture: Demi Lovato/Instagram)

Hey, if you’ve got it, flaunt it.

Advertisement

These selfies mark a new chapter Demi’s life, having previously been forced to ‘take a break’ from social media following body-shaming trolling.

However, last week the former Disney Channel star returned to Instagram with an unapologetically unedited picture wearing (another) leopard print bikini.

‘This is my biggest fear,’ Demi explained in the accompanying caption, ‘a photo of me in a bikini unedited. And guess what, it’s CELLULIT!!!!’

She continued: ‘I’m just literally sooooo tired of being ashamed of my body, editing it (yes the other bikini pics were edited – and I hate that I did that but it’s the truth) so that others think I’m THEIR idea of what beautiful is, but it’s just not me. This is what I got.’

Rising to fame as a teen, Demi has publicly battled with eating disorders and mental illness and suffered a near-fatal drug overdose last year, but has been keen to show that that time is behind her.

‘I want this new chapter in my life to be about being authentic to who I am rather than trying to meet someone else’s standards,’ she wrote.

‘So here’s me, unashamed, unafraid and proud to own a body that has fought through so much and will continue to amaze me when I hopefully give birth one day.’
